title: Rework "untargetable"
body:
Champions that become "untargetable" should be able to receive damage from AoE spells.

Allow me to explain:

Have you ever played Magic the Gathering? When something is untargetable it means you can't cast anything on it. HOWEVER, AoE spells can still damage the creature because those spells don't technically "target" it.

Shouldn't it be the same here? Fizz jumps on his pole and becomes untargetable. If Brand cast his Pillar of flames, shouldn't the fish get burnt?

Now before you guys down vote this, I said AoE spells. That means single target spells that are skillshots won't have any effect. So in Brands case, his Q and E won't work, but his W can still damage Fizz since he technically never targeted him.

Thoughts?

EDIT: Since there's some confusion on which spells would work; any spell that fully benefits from spell vamp has no effect on someone that's "untargetable".

Champions that leave the screen and come back (Elise, etc) can still maintain their old properties since there's a visual animation that they cannot be reached.

As someone who plays Magic, I can point out that comparing the game play of the two games is a bad idea. That said, "untargetable" is more like "Protection from sources your opponents control." And that's always how it's been intended. To really have an informed discussion, each such ability needs to be looked at individually, just as any one magic card must be looked at in terms of the associated spell effects, permanent abilities/p/t, cost, and whether or not it's on the banned or restricted lists for a given format. But even then, the balancing mechanics present in LoL and Magic are vastly different from one another.

the only thing that should change about "untargetable" is that my champ should still follow them when they become untargetable, and attempt to attack them when they become targetable.

Chasing a Fizz? Better spam right click, or you'll immediately walk backwards when he presses his trollpole.

Trying to kill a Yi in a teamfight? Well you'll immediately target someone else as soon as he presses Q, even if he's teleporting to an ally right beside you. Or heck, even if he's targeting YOU.
